What is Breaking News?
ما هي الأخبار العاجلة؟

Breaking news is an event we didn't anticipate. It is an unexpected development that requires us to pull all our resources together immediately to provide quick and accurate information to our audience. In many cases we will "break" into our regular programming to tell the audience about it even if, at first, we don't have all the details.

الأخبار العاجلة هي حدث لم نتوقعه. إنه تطور غير متوقع يتطلب منا جمع جميع مواردنا معًا على الفور لتوفير معلومات سريعة ودقيقة لجمهورنا. في كثير من الحالات، سنقوم «باقتحام» برامجنا العادية لإخبار الجمهور عنها حتى لو لم يكن لدينا، في البداية، كل التفاصيل.

Breaking news also refers to any significant advance on a story we're already covering. It can be a new piece of information that we feel our audience needs to know about. So the spectrum of breaking news is extensive, it can range from everything from a terror attack to something that's happening on the field of battle, to a weather event, to a political resignation.

Levels of Breaking News
مستويات الأخبار العاجلة

Determining the level of a breaking news story is inherently subjective. A change in government in a smaller country is certainly a major political development there but it might not resonate beyond its borders. One producer might consider a development in a story to warrant breaking news coverage while others in the newsroom might dismiss it as an incremental development.

إن تحديد مستوى قصة الأخبار العاجلة أمر شخصي بطبيعته. من المؤكد أن التغيير في الحكومة في بلد أصغر هو تطور سياسي كبير هناك، لكنه قد لا يتردد صداه خارج حدوده. قد يفكر أحد المنتجين في حدوث تطور في قصة ما لضمان تغطية إخبارية عاجلة بينما قد يرفضها آخرون في غرفة الأخبار على أنها تطور تدريجي.

"In the first instance, we deal with most forms of breaking news in much the same way. But then the question is, what are the consequences going to be? What sort of fallout will there be? Those are the kinds of questions that give breaking news a certain longevity and those are the things that we would be asking ourselves in terms of how we would be treating the level of breaking news as it happens."

«في المقام الأول، نتعامل مع معظم أشكال الأخبار العاجلة بنفس الطريقة تقريبًا. ولكن السؤال هو، ما هي العواقب التي ستكون؟ أي نوع من التداعيات سيكون هناك؟ هذه هي أنواع الأسئلة التي تعطي الأخبار العاجلة طول عمر معين وهذه هي الأشياء التي سنطرحها على أنفسنا من حيث كيفية تعاملنا مع مستوى الأخبار العاجلة فور حدوثها».

The third element we look at is the longevity of this breaking news event. How long this story is going to need our full-attention? Do we think this story which is currently developing will have longer-term implications?
العنصر الثالث الذي ننظر إليه هو طول عمر هذا الحدث الإخباري العاجل. إلى متى ستحتاج هذه القصة إلى اهتمامنا الكامل؟ هل نعتقد أن هذه القصة التي يتم تطويرها حاليًا سيكون لها آثار طويلة المدى؟

Of course we don't have a crystal ball to help us predict the future. But we can assess the facts that we have at the time to determine a story's longevity. We know, for example, a major terrorist attack in a key metropolis of a global superpower will trigger a series of events that go way beyond the immediate ground zero of the story. Recognizing that, we prepare our coverage plans and restructure our teams to meet those upcoming needs.

Typically, for regular news events CNN relies on Senior News Editors, SNEs, to vet the information before it gets alerted. Our reporters or producers on the ground will call in with a news item and that information will be pulled together by newsdesk producers and then vetted by an SNE. They will check the sources of the story, double check the information and use years of experience in the industry to spot any potential discrepancies in the information.

The aim of these messages are twofold. First, you are letting senior managers know something big is likely happening so they can start making decisions about deploying teams and whether CNN goes into "rolling" coverage.  Secondly, by letting everyone know you are aware of the story you're allowing a window of time to confirm details and to send out reportable lines.

Not everyone needs to know everything at all times. If you are working on a logistical issue then the editorial programming team in the middle of rolling coverage doesn't need to know. Make sure what you are communicating is relevant to who you are communicating it to.

Key Takeaways
الوجبات الجاهزة الرئيسية

Breaking news is something unexpected that is important enough for you to modify your regular programming to tell the audience about it. It is happening right now and requires the entire newsroom to shift into breaking news coverage mode.
الأخبار العاجلة هي شيء غير متوقع مهم بما يكفي لتعديل برامجك العادية لإخبار الجمهور عنها. إنه يحدث الآن ويتطلب من غرفة الأخبار بأكملها التحول إلى وضع تغطية الأخبار العاجلة.
Reporting.
إعداد التقارير.

In the immediate aftermath of a breaking news event, give your audience a sense of what is happening right now and provide them with the broader picture. Don't get bogged down in the details of the story or nuances that you can weave into the narrative at a later stage.
في أعقاب حدث إخباري عاجل، امنح جمهورك فكرة عما يحدث الآن وزودهم بالصورة الأوسع. لا تتورط في تفاصيل القصة أو الفروق الدقيقة التي يمكنك نسجها في السرد في مرحلة لاحقة.
Verification.
التحقق.

Your biggest priority during breaking news coverage is verifying the information that is pouring in. At the very least, you need to double source all the lines that you want to report on a story. Don't get lost in the fog of rumours and misinformation and don't sacrifice accuracy for speed.

أولويتك الأكبر أثناء التغطية الإخبارية العاجلة هي التحقق من المعلومات التي تتدفق. على أقل تقدير، تحتاج إلى مضاعفة مصدر جميع الأسطر التي تريد الإبلاغ عنها في القصة. لا تضيع في ضباب الشائعات والمعلومات الخاطئة ولا تضحي بالدقة من أجل السرعة.
Communication.
التواصل.

You need to ensure you are communicating what you know about a breaking news event both internally and to your audience. By alerting the rest of the network that you are aware of a breaking news situation you not only prepare them for it, you give yourself the opportunity to confirm reportable lines.

Nobody remembers if you broke a story two minutes before somebody else. But, a lot of people will remember if you got it first and you got it wrong.
